		Question: who was sir walter raleigh and what did he do
		Answer:
answer: Sir Walter Raleigh was an English explorer, courtier, and writer. He was a favorite of Queen Elizabeth I and played a leading role in the English colonization of North America. Raleigh was born in Devon, England, in 1552. He studied law at Oxford University and then served in the English army in Ireland. In 1584, he joined an expedition to North America led by Sir Richard Grenville. The expedition established the first English colony in North America, Roanoke Island, off the coast of present-day North Carolina. Raleigh returned to England in 1585 and was knighted by Queen Elizabeth. He became a favorite of the queen and was granted a large estate in Ireland. Raleigh made several more expeditions to North America, but none of them were successful. In 1595, he was arrested for treason and imprisoned in the Tower of London. He was released in 1603, but was executed in 1618 for his involvement in a plot to overthrow King James I.
